items.title: How a Public Record Cost Cuyahoga County Taxpayers $650,000
items.description: A worker’s demotion after releasing court records to The Marshall Project - Cleveland led to a lawsuit alleging retaliation and witness intimidation.

items.title: Nurses Say Staff Shortage at Missouri Prison Means Skipped Medication, Long Waits for Care
items.description: Current and former employees at Jefferson City Correctional Center say the shortage is causing unrest. They blame the state’s contractor, Centurion He...

items.title: Starve and Charge: Aramark Cut Free Prison Meals to Boost Profits, New Suit Claims
items.description: A lawsuit claims the prison food company is cutting institutional meals to force incarcerated people to purchase costly food from the same vendor.

items.title: Federal Agents Pepper Spray Protesters During Tucson Taco Shop Raid
items.description: See video from the scene as ICE officers attempted to disperse a crowd in the street outside the taqueria.

items.title: ‘Substantial Risk’: Mohican Young Star Academy Admissions Suspended as State Investigates
items.description: Weeks after The Marshall Project - Cleveland found escalating violence, Ohio’s embattled youth treatment center is once again facing scrutiny.
